snippet: The Obama administration said Friday that the enrollment records for roughly a quarter of all the people who signed up for health insurance on its website in October and November could contain errors.
abstract: Obama administration says enrollment records for roughly a quarter of all those who signed up for health insurance on its website in October and November could contain errors, raising questions about whether those consumers will get coverage in time to pay for their medical care; disclosure adds yet another complication to long list of technical troubles that have hampered the rollout of health care law.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration said Friday that the enrollment records for roughly a quarter of all the people who signed up for health insurance on its website in October and November could contain errors.

headline.main: Enrollment Errors Put Medical Coverage at Risk
headline.print_headline: Enrollment Errors Put Medical Coverage at Risk

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
